Currently, if you have two VS Code windows open with different folders, and try to drag a file from the explorer window of one into the explorer window of another, nothing happens.

It would be nice if this moved or copied the file (or maybe asked whether you wanted to move or copy it).

data.title: Feature request: Language completion in Terminal
data.body:
Terminal/Console is fundamental to languages like R and Python. VS provides completion in the Interactive Window so it would be great if VSC allowed extension to

a. Set language to the terminal (say, "R")
b. If language is set, call the respective language server for the completion

data.title: Add support for opening text documents as readonly (API)
data.body:
I've had a contribution of an explorer tree to show packages referenced by the current project. Because it's Dart, the packages are text on disk (not binary). Clicking on them opens the packages files so you can browse through them using `openTextDocument` however they're editable by the user.

As far as I can tell, there's no way to open a document as readonly? I saw that I can provide a readonly text document as HTML, but that means losing all the langauge support (highlighting, etc.) and having to convert code files into HTML!

It would be great if we could specific that a file should be readonly when calling `openTextDocument`.

data.title: Absolute path with root slash imports breaks intellisense
data.body:
Hi.
I been  struggling with absolute path imports because intellisense breaks (and go to definition too), this import statement breaks intellisense:
```
import Something form '/imports/collections/something.js';
```
But this one doesn't:
```
import Something from 'imports/collections/something.js';
```
The problem is that I'm using meteor, which works with the first import statment but not with the second one.

Is there a way to configure vs code for working with absolute imports that includes a root slash? WebStorm support this but I really like more vs code.

ps. sorry for my bad english

data.title: Git integration and built-in terminal do not "understand" from which root the current file is open

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: **1.15 - Insiders**
- OS Version: **macOS Sierra 10.12.5**

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a multi-root workspace, where every root is separate repository, for example roots **A**, **B** and **C**.
2. Try opening file from root **A** and then from **B** and then from **C**.

The following issues are observed:

1. The VS Code Git integration does not "understand" from which root/repository the file is open and hence cannot highlight the changes in file opened from roots **B** and **C**.
2. The built-in terminal also does not "understand" from which root the **current** file is open, and no matter from which root the file is open, will still be opening the root **A** directory.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Incorrect link underline in template string
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:22:50.650Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
EditorConfig|Edi|0.9.4
vscode-cdnjs|Jak|0.14.3
sort-lines|Tyr|1.3.0
vscode-icontheme-nomo-dark|be5|1.3.2
npm-intellisense|chr|1.3.0
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
auto-close-tag|for|0.4.3
gitblame|wad|2.0.2

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. use `https://www.scribd.com/embeds/'${scribdId}` in a template string in a javascript file

This will interpret the whole thing to be a link, underline it and allow cmd/ctrl clicks to a broken url.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9319710/28580889-c87a9c6a-712e-11e7-9754-4775516011a7.png)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Test: multi root debug
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29245

- [x] win  - **@egamma**
- [x] mac - **@jrieken**
- [x] linux - **@michelkaporin**

Complexity: 4

We have made debug multi root aware. First quickly verify you can debug a no folder workspace and a single folder workspace as before.

Open a multi root workspace where there are multiple `launch.json` files, verify:
* All configurations from every workspace are shown
* It is possible to add configuraitons to each of the `launch.json` from the dropdown
* Clicking on the configure action opens the appropriate `launch.json`
* Variables in the `launch.json` get resolved depending on where the `launch.json` is located, for example `${workspaceRoot}` resolves to the fs path of the root containg that `launch.json`
* Be creative and check if the UI behaves as one would expect

data.title: Search exclude not working for when conditionals
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
angular-bootstrap|her|4.0.6
Angular1|joh|0.2.0
csharp|ms-|1.11.0
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1
material-icon-theme|PKi|2.0.11
vs-code-office-ui-fabric|siv|0.1.7

(5 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create .ts and .js files with same name
2. Add the below to your settings json

  "search.exclude": {
    "**/.git": true,
    "**/.svn": true,
    "**/.hg": true,
    "**/CVS": true,
    "**/.DS_Store": true,
    "**/*.js": { "when": "$(basename).ts" }
}

3. Should exclude .js files, started happening at 1.14 I believe.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Implement virtual editor for showing workspace settings in multi root workspaces

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In Multi-root workspaces, workspace settings come from the workspace config file which has other configurations like `id`, `folders`.  Eg:

```
{
	"id": "1499978571481",
	"folders": [
		"file:///.../vscode",
		"file:///.../vscode-docs"
	],
	"settings":{
	    "editor.insertSpaces": false,
	    "files.eol": "\n",
       }
}
```

Hence, Settings editor needed a virtual editor for displaying only settings section of the config file for Workspace Settings. This should also support editing just like in other editors.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10746682/28518312-1196950c-7085-11e7-9f54-5dab76498d4a.png)

To get consistent experience in Settings Editor across, while editing settings in virtual editor (Workspace Settings), content is written directly into the real configuration file on disk. This needs #23413 Auto saving of settings for consistent experience.

data.title: [Feature request] Scroll offset/cursor margin parameter
data.body:
I'd love to see a similar feature to vims scroll offset: parameter that controls how many columns/rows from the window edge can the cursor be at minimum. Right now it seems to be set to 2 for rows at bottom, 1 for rows at the top, 2 for columns on the right and about 5 for columns on the left.

[Vim wikia page](http://vim.wikia.com/wiki/Keep_your_cursor_centered_vertically_on_the_screen) for reference.

data.title: No way to choose format of doc if not saved
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.1 (2648980a697a4c8fb5777dcfb2ab110cec8a2f58, 2017-07-13T19:18:47.188Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
csharp|ms-|1.11.0
mono-debug|ms-|0.15.6



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new file
2. Start typing markdown (or something else)
3. Open preview mode
EXPECT: Syntax hilighting for MD format and preview
ACTUAL: no highlighting or preview 

You need to save the file first to get this based on the file extension.  This is a good start, but it should enable me to select a format first before saving to get this.  Notepad++ allows me to do this easily before saving and enables me to save a doc as tim.foo (random file extension) and still select the format of the contents to be a file type.

![screenshot 12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4821/28578371-6cd21fde-710e-11e7-817c-691c8bc590dd.png)


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

2. Click the preview mode so that the doc is left source/right preview

data.title: Color issue with Typescript
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2 and before
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12

Steps to Reproduce:

In a .ts file:

let a: number = w, // number is colored
b: string = x,          // string is not colored
c: any = y,              // any is not colored
d: boolean = z;      // boolean is not colored

let e: any;              // any is colored
let f: boolean;       // boolean is colored
...

(It also works with const and var).

All the types should be colored but they are not when using commas: 
let something, somethingelse: any

Reproduces without extensions: Yes
